thread.title: Bond set at $1.5M for man accused of Peoria woman's killing
thread.title_full: Bond set at $1.5M for man accused of Peoria woman's killing

title: Bond set at $1.5M for man accused of Peoria woman's killing
text: PEORIA, Ill. -- A Peoria man is charged with killing a woman whose body was found in garbage bin behind a home. The (Peoria) Journal Star reports (http://bit.ly/1NuD1VM ) that bond was set Saturday at $1.5 million for 51-year-old Bobby L. Archie Jr. He is charged with first-degree murder in the death of 43-year-old Taquila Jackson. Peoria County State's Attorney Jerry Brady says Jackson died after she was struck with a metal object. He didn't offer details on a motive for the killing. A preliminary autopsy found Jackson died of head injuries. Jackson's body was found Thursday night two blocks away from Archie's residence. Online court records didn't list Archie's case. It is unclear if he has an attorney. There was no phone listing for Archie in Peoria. ___ Information from: Journal Star, http://pjstar.com Share this page
